message:
SYSTEM: DataCube.pdf: Página 2
Data cubes
•
A cube can be considered a multidimensional extension of 2-D 
tables (as in geometry a cube is a three-dimensional extension 
of a square)
•
The term hypercube is sometimes used, especially for data with 
more than three dimensions
•
Each dimension represents some attribute in the database 
(such as sales, profits, expenses…)
•
The cells in the data cube represent the measure of interest. For 
example, they could contain a count for the number of times that 
attribute combination occurs in the database, or the minimum, 
maximum, sum or average value of some attribute
•
Queries are performed on the cube to retrieve decision support 
information
2
speaker: SYSTEM
